metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8614 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: Multiple stack-based buffer overflows in the (1) conv_jistoeuc, (2) conv_euctojis, and (3) conv_sjistoeuc functions in codeconv.c in Claws Mail before 3.13.1 allow remote attackers to have unspecified impact via a crafted email, involving Japanese character set conversion.

criterions.comment: claws-mail: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
macopix: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
